meanings.definition: Cause (something) to change direction by interposing something; turn aside from a straight course.
meanings.sent1: The mirror deflects the light towards the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The umbrella deflects the raindrops away from me.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deflects the laser pointer all around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude deflects negativity like a shield.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape deflects bullets effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Turn aside from a straight course or intended purpose.
meanings.sent1: The student deflects from studying to play video games.
meanings.sent2: The car deflects from the main road onto a side street.
meanings.sent3: The plot of the movie deflects unexpectedly, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses deflect attention from the real issue at hand.
meanings.sent5: The river deflects around the large rock, creating a peaceful eddy.

meanings.definition: Cause (something) to change direction by interposing something.
meanings.sent1: The goalie deflects the soccer ball with a quick movement.
meanings.sent2: The magnet deflects the metal objects towards it.
meanings.sent3: The magician deflects the audience's attention with a flashy trick.
meanings.sent4: Her words deflect the blame onto someone else.
meanings.sent5: The wind deflects the leaves in all directions, creating a swirling dance.
